column2: IDAHO DMV PRACTICE TEST
column4: Idaho
column6: ID

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Broken white lines can be crossed over:
column4: when it is safe to change lanes.
column6: only when passing another car.

column2: 2. Which shape is a yield sign?
column4: Diamond
column6: Vertical rectangle

column2: 3. A flashing red light means:
column4: The same as a STOP sign.
column6: The light will soon change to steady red.

column2: 4. When passing another vehicle:
column4: you can exceed the posted speed limit.
column6: there is no need to signal.
column8: pass the vehicle as safely and as quickly as possible.
column10: honk your horn repeatedly to warn the other driver.

column2: 5. When you get in a car to drive, the first thing you should do is:
column4: check your rear view mirror.
column6: adjust your seat belt.

column2: 6. Anything that requires you to _______ could cause you to crash.
column4: take your attention away from driving
column6: take your hands off the wheel
column8: take your eyes off the road

column2: 7. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a low place in the road.
column6: a winding road.

column2: 8. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column4: speed up.
column6: use your brake lights.
column8: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.

column2: 9. When there is a _______ at an intersection, you should come to a complete stop, yield to cross traffic/pedestrians, and then proceed when clear.
column4: a solid green light
column6: a flashing yellow light

column2: 10. If you miss your exit from an interstate expressway, you should:
column4: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column6: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column8: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column10: pull over to the right and back up with caution until you reach the exit ramp.

column2: 11. When driving on wet roads, you should remember:
column4: driving on wet roads can cause hydroplaning.
column6: to stay farther behind the vehicle ahead of you.
column8: you should give yourself additional time to stop.

column2: 12. Drivers do not have to stop for a school bus if:
column4: they are traveling in the opposite direction on roadways with a total of four or more lanes (two or more lanes in each direction).
column6: the speed limit in the area is under 25 MPH.
column8: they are traveling in a residential area and the road has a large shoulder on each side.
column10: they are traveling in the same direction as the bus on a four-lane highway with two lanes going in the opposite direction.

column2: 13. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: in the opposite direction of the skid.
column6: in any direction. It doesnt matter.
column8: to keep the front wheels straight.
column10: in the direction you want to go.

column2: 14. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column4: vehicles from the left.
column6: vehicles from both directions.

column2: 15. This sign means:
column4: series of curves ahead.
column6: the road may be slippery when wet.
column8: no turns are allowed on this road.

column2: 16. This road sign indicates that:
column4: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column6: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column8: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.

column2: 17. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column6: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column8: enter the intersection and then stop.
column10: wait for the next green light.

column2: 18. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column6: go to the next entrance ramp.
column8: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.

column2: 19. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column6: slow down and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the left.

column2: 20. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column4: to you.
column6: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column2: 21. It is illegal to drive below the speed limit:
column4: when the pavement is wet.
column6: only in rural areas.
column10: when driving slowly disrupts the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 22. This sign indicates that the road ahead:
column4: turns sharply right, then left.
column6: curves right.

column2: 23. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column4: take turns more slowly.
column6: use alternate routes.
column8: drive as they would on dry roads.

column2: 24. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column6: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.

column2: 25. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must change lane immediately.
column6: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
column8: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Traffic flows only in the direction of the arrow
column6: Sharp curve ahead

column2: 27. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column4: Vertical rectangle
column6: Pentagon

column2: 28. This road sign is:
column4: a speed reduction sign.
column6: a regulatory sign.

column2: 29. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.
column6: delay near it.
column8: pay close attention to the turn signals.
column10: cut abruptly in front of it.

column2: 30. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.
column6: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.

column2: 31. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column6: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column10: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.

column2: 32. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column6: how fit you are.
column8: the type of beverage you drink.

column2: 33. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: go faster.
column6: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 34. This road sign means:
column4: Pedestrians must not cross
column6: School zone ahead

column2: 35. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column6: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column8: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.

column2: 36. This road sign means:
column4: No turn on red
column6: Do not pass
column8: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right

column2: 37. You must yield to other drivers:
column4: when it helps to prevent collisions.
column6: when they are driving a truck.
column8: when the other drivers are on your left and you have reached an unmarked intersection at the same time.
column10: when your traffic signal is a green.

column2: 38. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column4: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.
column6: cross the tracks.

column2: 39. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column6: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column10: keep less space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 40. This road sign means:
column4: Pass only in the right lane
column6: No left turn
column8: Cars in right lane must slow down
